first_reasoning: We recommend allocating the full $10 million to the Consumer Products Division because its relatively stable sales base and shorter product development cycles offer a higher likelihood of generating positive earnings within the 12–18 month window. By structuring the funding in tranches tied to clear R&D milestones—prototype completion, distribution commitments, go-to-market readiness—and requiring a governance plan with regular progress updates, we can de-risk our investment while accelerating a turnaround in consumer demand and margins.
second_reasoning: We direct the full $20 million to the Consumer Products Division because its stable sales base and shorter R&D-to-market cycle make it far more likely to generate a meaningful earnings turnaround within 12–18 months. By structuring the funds in milestone-based tranches tied to prototype completion, distribution commitments, and market launch—and requiring a governance framework with an executive sponsor and regular KPI reports—we maximize upside potential while safeguarding against downside risk.
